Class Congrats

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Congrats
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    A class to show the user that they've achieved a score in the top ten
    Version:
    Version 1.0 June 10th, 2012
    Author:
    Peng Chen, Branson Lee
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Congrats

        public Congrats(Window frame,
        java.lang.String difficulty,
        int score,
        int index)
        Creates a new Congrats to let the user know that they've achieved a score in the top ten high scores ever achieved. This contructor will draw out the title, purpose, the space for user to enter their name, and the buttons to either sumbit or exit without saving.
        Parameters:
        frame - A Window frame used to display this Jpanel on the current frame.
        difficulty - A String that stores what level the user was on.
        score - An int that represents the user's final score
        index - An int that represents the place of the user in the top ten high scores.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the JLabels and the JButtons that are created along this class.

        This method is inherited from JPanel.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Inherited parameter of paintCoponent which will point to Graphics and draw the background and the necessities that come with this screen.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method listens for actions thrown by buttons in the panel.

        This method will store the score in the top ten list if the user enters a name in the JTextField and that name is not blank. The user may also choose to exit and go back to the main menu without saving their score by pressing "Don't want to save score".

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - This is the action event thrown whenever a button is pressed.
